title: Side sheets
description: Side sheets are surfaces containing supplementary content or actions to support tasks as part of a flow.

contentChunks.htmlValue: They are typically anchored on the right edge of larger screens for tablets and desktops. There are two types of side sheets: standard and modal.

contentChunks.footer:
1. Standard side sheet
2. Modal side sheet

contentChunks.htmlValue: Resources

TypeLinkStatus

M2 guidelines â€“ Sheets: sideAvailable
ImplementationMDC-AndroidAvailable
Jetpack ComposePlanned
FlutterPlanned
WebPlanned

Takeaways

  • Side sheets provide optional actions at the bottom of the sheet.
  • Side sheets allow users to navigate to another region within the sheet. These sheets should leverage a back icon for consistent wayfinding and navigation control.
What's new

• Color: New color mappings and compatibility with dynamic color
  • Shape: Modal side sheets have a 16dp corner radius

contentChunks.footer: Side sheets have new color mappings to support dynamic color.

Color

Color values are implemented through design tokens. For design, this means working with color values that correspond with tokens. For implementation, a color value will be a token that references a value. Learn more about design tokens.

contentChunks.footer:
1. Standard side sheet
2. Modal side sheet

contentChunks.htmlValue: Usage

Side sheets are supplementary surfaces primarily used in tablet and desktop layouts. They provide a consistent and predictable surface for contextual actions and information.

Standard side sheets display content that complements the screenâ€™s primary content. They remain visible while users interact with primary content.

Common uses include:

  • Displaying a list of actions that affect the screenâ€™s primary content, such as filters
  • Displaying supplemental content and features

contentChunks.footer: Information about a photo in a standard side sheet

contentChunks.htmlValue: Modal side sheets are preferred on mobile instead of standard side sheets, due to limited screen size. They can display the same types of content as standard side sheets, but must be dismissed in order to interact with the underlying content.

contentChunks.footer: Modal side sheet with filter controls

contentChunks.htmlValue: Side sheets haveÂ a fixed width and typically span the height of the screen. Their dimensions depend on how the appâ€™s layout is subdivided into UI regions.

contentChunks.footer: Place side sheets along the edge of the screen, usually on the right side to avoid interference with any navigational components on the left edge. They can be slightly inset by 16dp.
Donâ€™t inset a side sheet from the screen edges far beyond the recommended margin. This makes the sheetâ€™s position and scroll behavior unclear, while obscuring primary content.

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Container

Side sheet containers hold all side sheet elements. Their size is determined by the space those elements occupy.
Â 
The container is the only required element of a side sheet. All other elements are optional.

contentChunks.footer: 1. Container

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Icon buttons (optional)

Icon buttons can provide ways to exit a side sheet or move to a different experience.

Because the primary content behind or beside a side sheet is always visible, itâ€™s important to provide affordances for leaving a side sheet and returning to the primary content.

contentChunks.footer: 1. Back icon button

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Close (optional)

A close affordance provides a consistent method for dismissing a side sheet. It is optional, although highly suggested, and increases accessibility by making focused side sheets easier to close.

contentChunks.footer: 1. Close icon button

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Buttons (optional)

Buttons represent actions available from a side sheet, and might include save, edit, or download. Use elevation, fill, and tone to call attention to specific actions.

contentChunks.footer: 1. Filled button

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Divider (optional)

Dividers can separate different types of content and create distinct regions in a side sheet.Â 

Actions might be separated from content using a divider, or user-generated content might be separated from system-generated content.

contentChunks.footer: 1. Divider

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Content (optional)

Side sheets can display a wide variety of content and layouts, ranging from a list of actions to supplemental content in a tabular layout.

contentChunks.footer: Form controls shown in a side sheet for app settings
Modal side sheets on smaller screens can transition to standard side sheets at larger screen sizes.

contentChunks.htmlValue: Responsive layout

Side sheets have a default width, but can be resized depending on the needs of the layout.Â 

Note that when a standard side sheet opens, the body area shrinks to accommodate the sheetâ€™s width while maintaining a margin on the bodyâ€™s trailing edge.

contentChunks.footer: Entrance of standard side sheets will cause the body area to adjust to accommodate.Â

contentChunks.htmlValue: Behavior

Side sheets can vertically scroll independent of the rest of the UI. This allows their scroll position and content to persist while the page is scrolled, and vice versa.

Side sheets cannot scroll horizontally.

contentChunks.footer: Side sheets can vertically scroll internally when their content exceeds the screen height.
Donâ€™t allow horizontal scrolling in a side sheet or layout in a way that suggests horizontal scrolling. A side sheetâ€™s narrow width leaves limited space to fully view items.

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Accessibility guidelines coming soon

In progress: complete guidance for accessible interaction, keyboard navigation, labeling, and more. Learn more about accessibility.
